intro: Melilotus petitpierreanus, commonly known as the Petitpierre melilot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
